Completeting the Abandoned Farm gives you a &3Petal Apothecary&r. This is your entry point into Botania, a magical automation mod that will help with certain tasks around the farm.
ftbquests.chapter.abandoned_farm.title: Abandoned Farm
ftbquests.chapter.armor_weapons__tools.q: All armor must start off with a leather or wool base.
Wool clothing can also be sewn if you can aquire a &6Sewing Table&r from a &6Leatherworker&r villager
&6Gold&r tools have increased attack damage, dig speed, and durability to &6Iron&r, unlike what you might expect in vanilla Minecraft.
&6Iridium&r tools and weapons are the equivalent of &6Netherite&r in vanilla minecraft, with slightly increased attack damage and dig speed.
&3Neptunium&r can be found from Neptune's Bounty, Crab Traps, and Neptuna.
The tools typically remove the underwater mining penalty, and weapons deal more damage underwater.
The &dGalaxy Sword&r is one of the most powerful swords in the game. It can be crafted with a &dPrismatic Shard&r and an Iridium Sword..
Note that it's a brand new sword- your enchantments will not carry over from the sword you trade.
The &6Flamarang&r is the upgraded version of &6Pickarang&r that cannot be destroyed by lava.
It also has higher damage and durability.
This chapter lists armor, tools, weapons, and other items that will help you on your journey to dominate the land.
It also lays out the tool progression.
&6Pickarangs&r can be used to mine at range, bringing drops back for you.
It works on any type of block a Diamond Pickaxe, Shovel, or Axe can.
&6Hooks&r allow you to get out of ditches fast and climb tall mountains.
They need to be in your curio slot and are activated using a hotkey.
You can buy one from the &6Blacksmith&r.
The &6Dragontooth Axe&r can only be wielded if you have the skill &6Dragonslayer&r on the Adventurer skill tree.
It's slow, extremely powerful, and does all the things an axe can!
&6Iron Hooks&r have two hooks, allowing you to float in midair.
The &6Diamond Hook&r increases the amount of hooks by 2, range of the hooks, and speed.
The &6Ender Hook&r is the fastest and highest range of all hooks, but only has one hook. Best for traveling, not as good for building.
The &6Blaze Hook&r is a direct upgrade in speed, but only has two hooks. It also sets mobs on fire if they pass through the hook chain.
The &6Red Hook&r is a special one that allows you to have creative flight in a small area defined by the hooks.
This makes your hook fairly useless for traveling however.
Creative flight is rare, so this will likely be your first way of obtaining it.
&6Backtanks&r can be charged with air via create rotation, and store air that can be used to breathe underwater while wearing a diving helmet.
The &6Iridium&r variants of the Backtank and Diving Helmet let you dive in lava, provided you have air.
You'll also need the full set of &6Iridium&r equipment to do so.
The &6Potato Cannon&r uses air in your backtank to launch vegetables at dangerous velocity.
The &6Extendo-Grip&r uses air to extend your reach for both placing, breaking, and attacking.
&6Gold&r armors have increased protection and durability to &6Iron&r, unlike what you might expect in vanilla Minecraft.
Pickaxes and shovels aren't the only way to mine blocks. These tools are sidegrades for mining that have various effects that make mining easier.
&6Mining Dynamite&r is highly efficient at breaking stone, dropping all the items on the ground at the point of contact.
&6Hammers&r are powerful tools that will let you break multiple blocks at a time.
They require cores to be crafted, and can be upgraded to increase range and metal tier.
Unfortunately, &l&6they do not pass enchantments to the upgraded tool&r due to a bug that the modpack dev can't figure out. Sorry!
&6Mace&r's are a Skull-Cavern exclusive weapon from the next major version of Minecraft. Their damage increases if you hit your target after a fall. The higher you fall from, the more damage!
They can be crafted from items found in trial chambers.
&eElectrum Armor&r increases the speed of the user by a significant amount, making them ideal for long range travel.
&eElectrum Tools&r increase in damage the faster the wearer is. This combines well with the armor, allowing you to rip and tear through mobs.
They also come built in with &6Fortune III&r.
&6Iridium&r armors are the equivalent of &6Netherite&r in vanilla minecraft, with slightly increased protection.
&3Neptunium&r can be found from Neptune's Bounty, Crab Traps, and Neptuna.
The armors give buffs to underwater movement, breathing, and utility.
ftbquests.chapter.artifacts.title: Artifacts
ftbquests.chapter.banners.quest1.descrip: Cook all dishes from &6Farm and Charm&r.
ftbquests.chapter.banners.quest1.title: Farm and Charmer
ftbquests.chapter.banners.quest81.descri: Cook all dishes from &6Farmer's Delight&r, &6Crabber's Delight&r, &6Veggies's Delight&r and &6Vintage Delight&r.
ftbquests.chapter.banners.quest81.title: Delightful Champion
ftbquests.chapter.banners.quest82.title: Cooking Collection Complete!
ftbquests.chapter.banners.title: Cooking
ftbquests.chapter.boiler_room.quest1.des: Completing the Boiler Room gives you the &6Kinetic Blueprint&r!
This item allows you to craft power sources for the &6Create&r mod, allowing you to fully automate your farm!
You can also craft the workstation for the &6Kinetic Mechanic&r, a villager that sells items crafted with the &6Kinetic Blueprint&r for convenience.
ftbquests.chapter.boiler_room.title: Boiler Room
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest1.descrip: Completing the &6Abandoned Farm&r yields a device used for elvish flower magic. It's difficult to obtain but studying this magic will undoubtly be useful to developing your farm.
The &6Mystical Botanist&r also has one of these for sale at a high markup.
The &6Lexica Botania&r will tell you most things you need to know about magic, and this questline will highlight Sunlit Valley specific applications.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest1.title: Intro to Flower Magic
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest10.descri: To use the mana stored in your &6Cropnolia&r, you'll need two devices.
The &6Mana Spreader&r is placed near your flower, and can move mana from it into a &6Mana Pool&r.
Using the &6Wand of the Forest&r, Shift + Right Click the Cropnolia, and then the Mana Spreader.
Finally, Shift + Right click the Mana Spreader and then the Mana Pool to bind them.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest10.title: Storing Mana
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest11.descri: Strangely enough, the energies of magic demand a financial tribute to work in your favor.
You shouldn't neglect your income on the farm, the flowers demand it.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest12.descri: The &6Cropnolia&r is your entrypoint to magic, converting fully grown crops in a 7x7 area around it into &bMana&r proportional to how long they took to grow.
It should be planted in a field where the harvest isn't so important, as crops that are culled by the Cropnolia do not drop anything.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest12.title: The Magic of Crops
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest13.descri: &6Bismuth&r is a metal that works as a conduit for magic.
Toss an ingot into a filled Mana Pool to create &6Manasteel&r, a common crafting ingredient for magic.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest14.descri: A &6Heart of Diamond&r has enough magical energy to be transformed into a &6Mana Diamond&r using mana when tossed into a pool.
If a heart isn't availible, a tribute of a &6Diamond Block&r can be transformed into one as a substitute.
Both transformations require a significant amount of mana.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest15.descri: &6Pearls&r are inherently magical in nature, but throwing one in a Mana Pool will bring out the energy using mana.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest16.descri: Runes can be harnessed to create oceanic weather changing shells. The &6Fluvial Shell&r sets the weather to rain, and is used as a base. These have a low durability, so careful usage is recommended.
Using more advanced runes, you create two mystical shells.
The &6Thunderous Shell&r turns the weather into a thunderstorm, while the &6Clement&r clears all weather.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest16.title: Magical Weather Shells
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest17.descri: &6Runes&r unlock the magical potential of the earth, allowing you to create more complex devices and flora.
They are crafted by tossing one of each ingredient into a &6Runic Altar&r and filling the altar with mana using a spreader.
Once the mana has filled, toss a peice of &6Living Rock&r on and use the &6Wand of the Forest&r.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest17.title: Crafting Runes
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest18.descri: By ascending your mana pylons into &6Gaia Pylons&r, you can engage in a deadly battle with the primal magical world...
You should refer to your &6Lexica Botania&r for the details.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest18.title: The Mystical Arena
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest19.descri: Harvesting from fruit trees with your bare hands gets old.
The &6Cornucopia&r harnesses elven wind magic to knock ripe fruits down for collection.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest19.title: Magical Harvesting
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest2.descrip: In order to work with botanical magic, you need the petals of &aMystical Flowers&r.
Fill the &6Petal Apothecary&r using a &6Water Bucket&r. From there, you'll need to toss 4 of a crop depending on the petal color, and any kind of seed.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest2.title: Growing Mystical Flowers
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest20.descri: With the power of the runes, an even greater power can be reached.
Follow the directions for assembling the &6Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate&r in the Lexica Botania.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest21.descri: &6Functional Flora&r are classified as magical flowers that utilize mana for peforming various actions.
The &6Lexica Botania&r will have information on all the different types.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest21.title: Functional Flora
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest22.descri: Keeping up with milking farm animals can be time consuming with all your other farming chores. The &6Mana Milker&r does this for you by gently milking farm animals using &bMana&r recieved from a Mana Spreader.
Unlike Deployers, farm animals don't mind being milked by this, but they won't recieve affection from being milked like usual.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest22.title: Mana Milking
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest23.descri: While the Cropnolia may be a good start for generating mana, it's far from the fastest.
&6Generating Flora&r are classified as flowers that are able to synthesize mana. As you progress, look to utilize the different types to upgrade your mana generating capacity.
The &6Lexica Botania&r will have information on all the different types.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest23.title: Generating Flora
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest24.descri: &6Mystical Flowers&r cannot be found in the world and &6Floral Fertilizer&r are disabled in this pack. Don't bother searching for hours around the world for either!
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest24.title: Why can't I find Mystical Flowers?
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest3.descrip: The &6Pure Daisy&r is an essential flower. When logs or stone are placed in the 8 spaces around it, they are slowly converted into more magical variants.
You'll need plenty of these blocks to progress through magic.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest4.descrip: There are certain fruits native to Alfheim that the elves will be willing to trade for.
In return they require their overworldian counterparts.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest4.title: Elven Fruits
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest5.descrip: The &6Elven Gateway&r is the link between the otherworldy, giving you access to materials beyond this mortal plane's comprehension.
Once activated according to the instructions in the &6Lexica Botania&r, items can be thrown in as an offering.
You should start by tossing your Lexica Botania in.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest5.title: Gateway to Alfheim
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest6.descrip: &6Terrasteel&r is the beginning of the most powerful items botanical magic has to offer.
You'll need half a Mana Pool's worth of mana to craft a Terrasteel ingot, provided using &6Sparks&r.
Toss the three required items on the plate, and be careful not to interrupt the ritual by picking up a crafting item.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest7.descrip: &6Terrasteel armor&r is a highly protective armor with various bonuses for the botanical master.
Unlike mundane armors, it takes durability damage from attacks, but can slowly be repaired using any mana in your inventory.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest7.title: Terrasteel Armor
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest8.descrip: The Terra set of tools and weapons have various bonues.
- &6Truncators&r fell trees in a single blow
- &6Shatterers&r allow you to mine in a large area, and can be upgraded using mana to increase the area mined up to 9x9
- &6Blades&r come with an additional ranged attack using mana
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest8.title: Terra Tools
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest9.descrip: Once grown, Mystical flowers can be crafted into petals that are used to magically create different flowers.
You'll need at least &6white&r, &6yellow&r, and &6orange&r to start magic.
&oPetals cannot be planted and bonemeal like you may be able to do in other packs...&r
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quest9.title: The Mystical Petals
ftbquests.chapter.botania.title: IV.II - Mystical Farming

ftbquests.chapter.getting_started.quest1: This questline will take you through the basics of the pack to get you started farming.
The Basics

Hoarding your coins in random chests isn't ideal. The &6Bank Terminal&r is an ATM, allowing you to store your coins safely. You can access your money from any other Bank Terminal, like an Ender Chest.
It can be purchased from the &6Banker&r villager.
Storing Money
The &6Bounty Board&r will have bounties requesting different items or tasks done in exchange for coins or other items.
Right click a completed bounty on the board to complete.
By default it will come with one of four different types of &6Decrees&r, which determine which items will be requested.
Bounties
&6Prize Tickets&r can be found as a reward from some harder bounties.
Each time you submit one to a &6Prize Machine&r, you'll recieve an item. The more you submit, the better the rewards are until it loops.
Right click on the &6Prize Machine&r for a hint on the next prize!
Cool Prizes
There are 5 skill trees that can be leveled, unlocking special abilities useful to you. You can view these trees using &6K&r by default.
&6Farming&r experience comes from harvesting crops, eating cooked meals, and using Artisan Machines (such as Preserves Jars or Looms).
&6Husbandry&r experience comes from taking care of animals.
&6Mining&r experience comes from mining ores and Geode Nodes, provided you aren't using Silk Touch.
&6Fishing&r experience comes from catching fish, crafting fishing equipment, and harvesting from Fish Ponds.
&6Adventuring&r experience comes from killing mobs and especially from looting chests.
Skills and Levels
Gather logs and stone, and submit them to this quest in order to recieve a free starter farmhouse.
You can see a preview of these in the Building Shop.
&6Right Click&r with a Capsule to preview the structure. Click again to build.
&6Left Click&r to rotate, &6Shift + Left Click&r to mirror
&oNote: If the preview doesn't show at first, use &6Left Click&r&o to rotate.
Any #society:raw_logs
Constructing a Farmhouse
You may notice the tiers of armor and tools have been slightly tweaked.
Iron now upgrades to &6Gold&r before &bDiamond&r, adding another step in progression.
Unlike vanilla, the &6Gold&r tools are balanced inbetween both tiers.
Changed Tiers
Wondering why your tools aren't breaking? All of the main tools and armors have &6infinite&r durability when used.
There's one small tradeoff: these tools lose 15%% + 15 durability on death. This only applies to equipment in your hotbar and armor.
Tools can be repaired in an anvil infinitely, with significantly lower experience costs. Unbreaking also reduces the amount of durability lost.
Not quite...
Understood'
No Durability?
Unlike vanilla Minecraft, crops need water to grow, and farmland won't be hydrated from nearby water!
They can be watered using a &6Watering Can&r, which will need to be done every day.
Every morning at &66 AM&r, farmland will dry up and crops will grow on your farm. If the farmland is dry, your crops will die!
Watering Crops
Crops have 3 different tiers of Quality: &7Iron&r, &6Gold&r, and &bDiamond&r.
The value of the crop increases based on the tier of quality, and is reflected in the tooltip!
Understood!
Crop Quality
&6Villagers&r can be tough to move around. You can carry them by &6shift + right clicking&r when both hands are empty. This also works on animals too!
If you're out of &6Villager Spawn Crates&r, more can be bought from the Market block.
Managing Villagers
ftbquests.chapter.getting_started.quest2: Upgrading your tools past wood requires a &6Smithing Table&r. At higher tiers it will require a Smithing Template purchased from a &6Blacksmith Villager&r.
Tools can be repaired in an anvil infinitely, and enchantments also carry over when upgrading!
Search for an item in the item list sidebar and &6Left Click&r on it to see its recipes.
Some biomes such as &6Savannas&r and &6Jungles&r will always be treated as &6Summer&r for crop growth only. They will be marked as "Wet Season" and "Dry Season".
This can be used to create a secondary farm that has no need to worry about seasons!
The same applies to frozen biomes for &6Winter&r.
Skill paths split multiple times, and you might not like what you've picked!
Thankfully the &6Cleric&r villager sells &6Crystals of Regret&r for each skill tree. They are one-time use, resetting your skill tree completely.
It refunds &65 skill points&r, so you don't have to start completely from 0.
You can share a bank account with your friends in multiplayer!
Purchase a &6Blaze Banker&r and a &6White ID Card&r + &6White Card&r for each player from the &6Banker&r villager. Each player must right click to bind the ID card and add it to the Blaze Banker.
Finally, place &6White Card&r into the bottom left slot of the Blaze Banker to bind it. You can then access the account by right clicking a &6Bank Terminal&r with the card.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_started.quest3: To get started making money, you'll need a &6Basic Shipping Bin&r.
Items placed inside that have a sell value will be sold at &66 AM&r for the value listed in the tooltip.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_started.quest4: Coins can also be found in loot chests around the world.
Exploring is a good way to make cash before you get your roots farming!
Keep an eye out for Pumpkins and Hay Bales in the world as well, they sell for good money early.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_started.quest5: You found a &6Geode&r! Place it in your offhand, and right click with a &6Geode Buster&r to open it.
If you're lucky you might get a valuable gem.
If not, there's more where that came from! Geode Busters can be bought from the &6Blacksmith&r villager.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_started.quest6: Tired of paying the Blacksmith to open &6Geodes&r? Buy the &6Extractinator&r from one!
Right click it with a &6Geode&r to pop it open, free of charge.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_started.quest7: There are 6 main tiers of &6Coins&r, and they can be crafted up or down from the previous tier.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_started.quest8: With coins in your pocket, you have enough capital to start spending freely!
Start your village off with a &6Blacksmith&r, an essential villager that can help you upgrade tools, open geodes, and get to the &6Nether&r.
See the &6Villagers&r chapter in the quest book for more information.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_started.quest9: By now you've probably become annoyed with storing the many items on your journey.
A &6Backpack&r will come in handy, purchase one from the &6Leatherworker&r villager.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_started.title: I - Getting Started
ftbquests.chapter.ii__building_up_the_fa: Your journey into farming starts with the &6Market&r, which sells a variety of basic seeds and saplings.
Some crops only grow in certain seasons, which is designated in the crops's tooltip.
Seasons last &630 minecraft days&r, and hot or cold biomes will be always be Summer and Winter respectively.
Equipping the Calendar will show the current sub-season in the top left of your screen.
Craft a market to buy seeds
Starting Farming
Oak, Dark Oak, Spruce, and Pine trees can be tapped using a &6Tapper&r.
The type of tree tapped will determine how many days it will take to complete as well as the output.
Tapping Wood
Buying seeds for crops that require them really eats into your margins. The &6Seed Maker&r turns crops into seeds for free.
Using crops with any quality will turn the seed into the lowest quality inputed into the &6Seed Maker&r in &61&r day.
Quality seeds will have a higher chance to grow quality crops, making it worth your time to produce good seeds!
&6Greenhouse Glass&r is a special material that lets crops up to 16 blocks underneath grow during any season.
It's probably far too expensive at this point in the game to craft, but a few blocks over key crops can make a difference.
&6Pine Tar&r is tapped from Spruce and Pine trees and is mainly used for advanced farming devices.
&6Oak Resin&r is tapped from oak logs, and is used as a sealant for many fluid-related items.
Brewing beer is a good way to start on producing &6Artisan Goods&r on your farm.
Dried ingredients need to be processed in the &6Silo&r.
The Brewing process itself requires attention and is slightly complex. You can hold &6W&r while hovering over the Brewingstation to learn how to brew beer.
Brewing Beer
Each sellable item in the pack has one of four categories:
- 🔱 &6Farmer&r - Raw crops and cooked meals
- ✎ &6Artisan&r - Items made in Artisan Machines by hand, such as Preserves, Beer, Wine, Cheese, etc.
- 🎣 &6Geologist&r - Ores, gems, and minerals. Anything out of the ground.
- 🗡 &6Adventurer&r - Looted artifacts and other rare items.
The category is only relevant when it comes to skills, which may increase certain categories if taken.
Understood!
Artisan Goods?
Bundles are the first large goal of the pack. They require certain items to be submitted, giving small rewards for each bundle, and large rewards when all bundles are completed.
The most important right now is:
Consisting of products that can grow on your farm.
The Spring Crops Bundle (Click Me)
Bundles
The next place to exploit for its resources is the &6Nether&r.
It's a dangerous place, but has the important resource &6Fire Quartz&r, needed for advanced farm building.
Getting to the Nether
In this pack, raising farm animals requires care, money, and attention.
A &6Shepherd&r villager will be needed for basic supplies.
Raising Farm Animals
The &6Farmer&r sells supplies that'll help increase the efficiency of your farming, such as fertilizers.
You can place the villager on the &6Seat&r to keep them from wandering off.
Farmer Villager
All farm animals require &6Animal Feed&r regularly to produce their products. They need to be fed once every Minecraft day.
If an animal goes too long without being fed, they won't be very happy with you...
Feeding Animals
Raising Animals
Farm animals require love and attention! They can be pet once a day with an added bonus if you feed them by hand.
Cramped conditions where more than 4 or so animals are walled in or packed together will make them lose happiness.
Right click a farm animal with an empty hand to see their affection.
Understood
Affection
Hand feeding animals can be a challenge with the amount of everyday farming chores.
A &6Feeding Trough&r does this for you to any animals in range, provided it has Animal Feed.
Birds such as Chickens will produce eggs, but won't produce them as fast when at lower levels of affection.
They'll produce larger eggs at high levels of affection.
Any egg
Eggs
Cows, Sheep, Goats, Wooly Cows, and Water Buffalos can all be milked.
Milking animals requires a special &6Milk Pail&r for collection.
The size of the milk will depend on how much the animal likes you!
Any milk
Milk
&6Truffles&r are valuable goods, found by Pigs when they have at least 5 hearts of affection.
There's no reason to kill your farm animals you love and care for!
&6Magic Shears&r will allow you to harvest their drops using otherworldy magic on right click.
Animals will only let you do this if they have high enough affection, and it can only be done once per day.
Cruelty Free Meat
Turning Eggs into Mayonnaise is a good way of increasing profits from chickens.
This can be done with a &6Mayonnaise Machine&r in &61&r day.
&oYou'll want to take a look at the farming quest line for information on how to get the ingredients for one.&r
Milk can be pressed into cheese using an &6Artisan Cheese Press&r.
&oYou'll want to take a look at the farming quest line for information on how to get the ingredients for one.&r
Fish are a fast and valuable way to make money early game.
Your first rod will come from the &6Fisher&r villager, and they otherwise sell aquatic and fishing related supplies.
Barrel
Fishing
Watering your crops every morning gets old fast.
&6Sprinklers&r help you out by keeping farmland hydrated in a radius around them.
The basic Iron tier works in a 3x3 area centered around it.
They can also be right clicked with a stick to add support for decoration.
Upgraded rods can be equipped with attachments using a &6Tackle Box&r.
They will also have a chance to upgrade enchantments from succesful catches. The chance increases on higher upgraded rods.
Any upgraded fishing rod
Upgrading Your Rod
&6Tackle Boxes&r are used to customize your rod using the slots on the right. They also retain their inventory when broken.
&oOnly upgraded rods can be customized.&r
Baits can be added using a &6Tackle Box&r and have various effects on your rod.
Any fishing hook
Fishing Hooks
Baits can be added using a &6Tackle Box&r and decrease the amount of time between bites.
They are slowly consumed, and better baits such as &6Leeches&r and &6Minnows&r have a higher amount of durability.
Any Bait
Baiting Fish
Any compostable material can be used on a &6Worm Farm&r to produce worms.
A much cheaper alternative to pruchasing them.
&6Geode Nodes&r rarely found in caves have a chance of dropping &6Aquamarine,&r the main crafting material for fishing related tools.
Crab Traps will provide certain fish, junk, or treasure over time. They must be surrounded by a 3x3 of water, and be provided with &6Crab Trap Bait&r.
&6Deluxe Crab Trap Bait&r improves the chance of catching seafood and treasure from Crab traps, and decreases the chance of junk.
The Deluxe Worm Bin upgrades basic &6Crab Trap Bait&r in &61&r day.
&6Fish Smokers&r are used to create smoked fish, which multiplies the value of a fish by &64&r in &62&r days.
Artisan Fish
&6Fish Ponds&r cultivate fish over time once a single fish is placed in. Roe and other items can be harvested from them, and more items are unlocked at certain fish populations.
Sometimes the fish will request items in order to grow their populaton.
You'll need a 3x4 of water (or lava for nether fish) behind the pond according to this professional diagram:
&3⬜⬜⬜ <- Water/Lava
&6⬜   <- Fish Pond block
{image:society:textures/gui/fish_pond_example.png width:150 height:150 align:center}
Farming Fish
Once you find an appropriate place to start your farm, your first step should be preparing a field of farmland.
Once your crops are fully grown, you can &6Right Click&r to harvest without losing the seed! Hoes can do this an an area.
Any Hoe
Preparing the Fields
&6Treated Logs&r can be made by right clicking Oak Resin onto any Log in world.
&3Neptunium&r is a precious material used in crafting advanced fishing gear.
It can be found in &3Neptune's Bounty&r you fish up, or rarely in Crab Traps.
Fruit trees slowly grow fruits that can be hand picked.
A handfull of basic ones can be purchased from the Market, but you'll need to dive into the &6Skull Cavern&r for more advanced ones.
The fruits can be moved by breaking them with &6Shears&r and placed under other leaves.
Any Fruit Tree
Fruit Trees
Bone Meal cannot be used to grow crops, so you'll need to find more advanced and expensive options.
Weaker Bone Meal
The &6Canvas Loom&r is an artisan machine for making &6Artisan Canvas&r and &6Merino Wool&r in &61&r day.
These products can either be sold, crafted into useful items, or sewn into clothing using a &6Sewing Table&r.
Some large fruits will need to be mashed using an &6Apple Press&r to process into other drinks.
Pressing Large Fruits
&6Small Ships&r can be crafted using &6Artisan Canvas&r, allowing quicker sailing through the ocean. By default, the &6R&r hotkey can be used to drop the sail.
These can be used to transport large amounts of exotic farm animals from far away lands.
Set Sail
Beds can keep you stuck in one place to avoid losing your home.
The &6Sleeping Bag&r solves this by allowing you to sleep away the night while not setting your spawn.
Sleep Anywhere
The fish you'll catch depends on 4 factors: &aSeason&r, &6Location&r &aWeather&r, and &6Time&r.
Each of the four &aseasons&r have their own fish. Each &6location&r (Ocean, River, or Freshwater) has its own pool.
Finally, some fish can only be caught during night or day.
Mining ores in cold biomes or &bWinter&r will have a chance to give you &6Frozen Geodes&r.
Outside of that they can drop from &6Slush&r in cold biomes (affected by fortune), or frozen zombies in &bWinter&r.
The &6Farmer's Almanac&r has detailed information of crops and farm animals, which is essential when deciding what to focus on every season.
It is sold by the &6Farmer&r and &6Shepherd&r
All on Farming
The &6Sewing Table&r can cut Artisan Canvas into clothing and hats when combined with other materials.
It requires a &6Sewing Needle&r to craft.
Crafting it with a &6Chest&r allows it to retain its inventory.
Sewing Clothing
Is your hotbar a mess? A &6Toolbelt&r can store your tools for quick access using a single hotkey (&6X&r by default).
By default it can only carry two slots, but multiple &6Belt Pouches&r can be sewn in for more slots.
&6Preserve Jars&r turn fruits and vegetables into preserves in &64&r days, multiplying their selling value by over &63&r.
Having many run in the background is worth the investment.
Tropical biomes such as &6Savannas&r and &6Jungles&r will always be treated as &6Summer&r for crop growth only.
This can be used to create a secondary farm that has no need to worry about seasons!
The same applies to frozen biomes for &6Winter&r.
Visit a tropical Biome
Eternal Summer
There are occasions where you may need a large quantity of one specific fish. The &6Bait Maker&r turns one of any type of fish into targed bait!
This bait can be placed inside of a &6Crab Trap&r,
&oNether Fish can be caught in a Crab Trap placed in water... Strange.&r
Don't just stuff your farm with nameless livestock- naming a farm animal will make them like you a good bit more!
Pet Names
&6Watering Cans&r can be upgraded to hold more water, work faster, and also work in an area!
Hold &6Shift + Right Click&r to charge up the area of affect watering ability. Higher tiers have higher areas!
Upgraded Watering
By now you might have run out of money while getting your crops started.
It's a good time to dig into stone to get materials needed to craft sprinklers or upgrade tools.
Hitting the Mines
While caving, you might come across these rare minerals.
&6Earth Crystals&r are an important crafting ingredient, so collect as many as you can.
Their soft glow gives them away in dark caves.
Hidden in the Stone
&6Fertilizer&r is a huge step in upgrading how much your farm produces.
Simply right click on the farmland to gain the affects.
Any Fertilizer
All on Fertilizers
Cooking is essential early on, for both keeping you alive in the mines and making profit.
A few basic ones can be crafted using &6Earth Crystals&r.
In general, cooked meals are worth &61.2x-2x the sum of their ingredients&r! Complex dishes (ones with many ingredients) have an additional boost to their value as well.
Any cooking station
Getting Cooking
II - Farm Building
The &6Nether&r is the next area to exploit for its natural resources.
Getting there will prove fairly trivial, but surviving is a trial for the unprepared...
Nether? I...
Get to the Nether
&6Gold Sprinklers&r are a direct upgrade to the iron tier, giving a larger radius.
Gold Sprinklers
&6Diamond Sprinklers&r are far more expensive than the previous tier, but work in a significant area.
The &6Mincer&r is a cooking implement for prepping ingredients, but has a secondary use: &6Chunkroderite&r.
Any geode mineral can be ground up, with the amount of &6Chunkroderite&r increasing with the value of the mineral.
The primary use for &6Chunkroderite&r is fuel for the &6Fueled Chunk Loader&r. It force loads a 3x3 chunk area, while allowing crops to grow unlike any other chunk loaders.
Outside of &6Chunkroderite,&r gems such as &6Diamonds&r and &6Emeralds&r can be used to add time.
This can be used to chunkload an area without the need for claiming a chunk.
The one thing that stands between you and mining wealth is the &6Skull Cavern Teleporter&r.
As you mine &6Boulders and Ore&r you'll find ropes going down, taking you to more dangerous and rewarding areas.
&cStaying in the Skull Cavern overnight is dangerous.&r
&c&lYou will faint and be sent home if you're inside it past 5:50 AM.&r
&oBe sure you're absolutely prepared before entering, with enchanted armor and extra hearts...
Complete the Vault Bundle
The Skull Cavern
&6Jade&r can be found from &6Omni Geode Nodes&r. It's an expensive mineral used for a handful of useful crafts.
&dPrismatic Shards&r are the ultimate form of power on Sunlit Valley.
They craft into many of the most powerful items, and have various hidden uses.
The &6Aging Cask&r ages items over large periods of time, multiplying their sell value by &64&r.
Wine will take take &610&r days to age, while other items like Beer, Whisky, and Cheese take a shorter amount of time.
Mining ore in the Skull Cavern has a chance to drop &6Omni Geodes&r.
They can be extracted for any tier of mineral, and have a chance to drop &6Iridium Scrap&r and &dPrismatic Shards&r when extracted.
The final tier of Sprinkler, the &6Iridium Sprinkler&r has the highest range out of any.
&6Fire Quartz&r is the gate to more advanced farming equipment.
It can be found scattered around the Nether, and glows brightly.
&6Trial Chambers&r spawn sparsely in the Skull Cavern.
&dRelics&r can drop from both tiers of vaults, and they are one of the few ways of obtaining them.
Having the &6Bad Omen&r effect increases the difficulty of the chambers but greatly increases the rewards.
Find a Trial Chamber
The &6Master Cultivator&r villager can be made using a special cooking pot crafted from a &dPrismatic Shard&r.
Higher value crops are sold by this villager, as well as expensive fruit trees.
Advanced Crops
The &6Basic Shipping Bin&r is too simple for mass selling goods as your farm grows.
The &6Smart Shipping Bin&r fixes many issues with not being able to sell goods, such as when there's not enough space for coins. It sells every 5 minutes.
A &6Basket&r can be placed underneath the output face to capture coins.
Smarter Selling
&6Mushroom Soil&r grows mushroom colonies when mushrooms are planted on them.
When the colonies are broken, they drop a handful of mushrooms, allowing for farming them.
Crops can be processed in a &6Fermenting Jar&r to increase their value and nutrition.
There also have a few utility recipes for farms, such as Froglights and Slime Blocks.
&6Organic Mash&r is difficult to come by, but grows any type of crop instantly. It is a byproduct of producing &6Vinegar&r.
&6Plant Nutrients&r are made from Weak Fertilizer and can be used for crafting more advanced versions of them.
Its got electrolytes
&6Enriched Bonemeal&r can be used to grow crops such as Glowberries, Lavender, and Hibiscus.
More effective fertilizers can be crafted using &6Plant Nutrients&r. Any good farmer will work towards stockpiling them.
Any advanced fertilizer
Advanced Ferilizers
The &6Dehydrator&r can be used to dry fruits or vegetables in &61&r day. Fast, but not as profitable as other means.
The first one will need to be bought from a &6Farmer&r, but more can be crafted using &6Raisins&r.
In the Nether, native fish can be caught using the &6Lava Fishing Rod&r.
They will also randomly upgrade enchantments from succesful catches.
Since the Nether has no season, the same fish can be caught at any time. Some fish are biome dependent though.
If you haven't been paying attention to your skills, you'll find that some of them directly map to certain enchantments!
The &6Enchanting Table&r will allow you to unlock the final level of enchantment for things like Fortune or Looting, alongside enchantments that aren't included in the skill tree.
The maximums of enchantments that are in the skill tree has been lowered!
Enchanter
High quality items can lead to a huge increase in profits, but it can make automation and storage a hassle.
The &6Quality Washer&r removes quality from crops inserted into it, pushing it into the inventory below.
Removing Quality
During exploration you may have come across a &6Slime Heart&r. These are precious items that can be used to begin Slime Incubating!
To start, right click a &6Slime Incubator&r with the heart. Both can be purchased from a &6Shepherd&r as well.
Slime Incubating

Each &6Slime&r will drop a different type of &6Plort&r when fed a food in their diet. The humble &dSlimy Slimes&r will eat flowers, but more advanced Slimes will have higher standards. You can tell a Slime's diet by hovering over it in world.
Each slime has a favorite food that will cause them to drop double Plorts.
The &6Plort Rippit&r can be used to turn Plorts into various resources depending on the breed.
Rippit!
Slimes cannot reproduce by breeding. Instead, their &6Plorts&r must be pressed into another &6Slime Heart&r using a &6Plort Press&r.
Hearts can also be combined to make new ones using the top and bottom slots.
&oHearts are worth twice as much as their Plort!&r
Pressit!
&6Corral Blocks&r keep your Slimes mostly safe, keeping them contained while allowing anything else to move in and out.
When given a redstone signal, they will prevent non-slime mobs from leaving as well.
Sllimes can be turned into a &6Largo&r by feeding a &6Plort&r of a different breed to it!
Largos inherit all the qualities of both slimes, dropping one plort of each kind.
But be careful, feeding a Largo a third type of plort will turn it into a &6Tarr&r- an evil creature that gobbles up nearby slimes...
Understood
Largoit!
&6Splendid Slimes&r are lovely creatures that produce a valuable byproduct when fed: &6Plorts&r!
They start out as wild, but once you feed them a food in their diet, they'll be tamed and won't despawn.
They're simpler than farm animals, though you may find they cause a bit more chaos...
Wrong Game?
Observe Splendid Slime
Slime Ranching
Slimes can be found throughout the world. The Slime Vac can suck them up into inventory form using &6Shift + Right Click&r.
You can then fire them out using Right Click, if the Slime item is in your other hand. You can also suck up and shoot out items!
&oIf you look at the recipe in JEI using the Slime icon, you may find hints on where some types may be hiding.&r
Slime Stealing
Slimes' happiness depends on their hunger and living conditions. Every time they eat, their &6happiness&r will increase. If they're surrounded by similar types of Slimes, they'll get happier!
Happiness decreases when Slimes are hungry or crowded (more than &67&r in an area).
When unhappy, Slimes may cause status effects to their surroundings. The more valuable their Plorts are, the more deadly they may be...
I will nurture Slimes
Slime Happiness
In order to channel the power of lightning, a large amount of &6Blaze Rods&r will be needed.
Aim for at least &67&r of them.
Harnessing Fire
As you dive deeper into the Skull Cavern, you might encounter something called &dSparkstone&r.
It is a gem filled with intense energy that can be used to power advanced farming equipment for automation.
The &6Artisan Hopper&r is a machine powered by &dSparkstone&r that can automate collection from adjacent &6Artisan Machines&r!
Items placed in the inventory above it will automatically be inserted into nearby Artisan Machines that can take those items, no filtering needed!
It requires Sparkstone in its inventory an inventory below it to deposit items.
The &6Auto-Grabber&r is a machine powered by &dSparkstone&r that can automate collection from husbandry farm animals!
Unlike Create Deployers, these devices use any Husbandry skills you might have unlocked, and animals don't lose happiness from harvesting!
It requires Sparkstone in its inventory an inventory below it to deposit items.
The &6Exotic Trader&r villager's workstation can be crafted with a &dPrismatic Shard&r.
It will trade various farm items for Machine upgrades. These upgrades add special effects when applied to the machine.
There are also some handy utility trades for useful but annoying to obtain items, such as Wither Skeleton Skulls.
Any Upgrade
Machine Upgrades
The &6Fish Pond Basket&r is a machine powered by &dSparkstone&r that can automate collection from adjacent &6Fish Ponds&r!
It requires Sparkstone in its inventory an inventory below it to deposit items.
There are 3 advanced tiers of &6Coins&r. The first two can be crafted up or down from the previous &dPrismatic Coins&r must be traded using a &6Bankers&r,
These are their values:
- Neptunium (&632,768&r)
These coins are needed for very late game items. Don't expect to need them anytime soon.
The final layer of the &6Skull Cavern&r holds two different biomes.
One of them is the &6Umbra Barrens&r, a place you might find familiar from another world...
&oIf you haven't noticed there is no End in Sunlit Valley.&r
Visit the Umbra Barrens
The Bottom of the Skull Cavern
Each &6Splendid Slime&r has different effects that may happen when they are unhappy or happy.
On top of that, Slimes may also have &6Traits&r: different behaviors or quirks that make ranching them more difficult.
Always check the traits of a Slime you're ranching by looking at the uses of a Slime in item form using JEI!
&oRocket Pods can be launched at your feet using the Slime Vac to rocket jump.&r
Understood
Slime Traits
Infused with the energy of &dSparkstone&r, the &6Cornucopia&r causes nearby fruit trees to drop their fruits in a large radius around you when used.
Easier Fruit Tree Harvesting
Mining the different types of &6Boulders&r in the Skull Cavern has a small chance to yield &6Iridium Scrap&r. The lower you dive, the higher the chance it drops.
4 scrap can be combined with 4 &6Bismuth Ingots&r to make an &6Iridium Ingot&r.
&oYou may even find Iridium Ore at the lowest levels...&r
&6Charging Rods&r take lightning from storms and create Batteries, used in crafting items that use electricity.
They don't work in Winter, as no stormy weather occurs.
Capturing Lightning
Each Slime breed has a favorite food. Feeding it to them will give them a big boost in happiness, while also causing them to produce &6double plorts&r!
Largo Slimes have multiple favorite foods, inherited from both breeds!
I will feed my Slimes food they love!
Favorite Foods :pink_heart:
Batteries are need to craft the &6Espresso Machine&r, which lets you make &6Espresso&r and &6Steamed Milk&r.
Unlike other Artisan Machines, drinks made with &6Espresso&r are 🔱 Farmer products.
Expensive and slow, the &6Crystalarium&r will duplicate any gem or mineral placed inside. The amount of days to complete will depend on the inserted item.
They should be your first goal if you dislike mining for crafting minerals.
Growing Crystals
Wine can be made using a &6Fermentation Barrel&r. This is a lengthy process, but quite profitable.
Wines also have special affects that improve overtime as the wine exists in the world.
To start, use the &6Grapevine Pot&r to make juice. You can hold &6W&r while hovering to see how.
&oSeeds can be planted on Grass or Grapevine Stems. Jungle Seeds need Lattices.&r
By now, your farm should have enough tools in order to make a steady income. Your next step should be unlocking the Skull Cavern.
The rewards on their own will make up for the cost.
Complete the Vault (Click Me)
Making Real Money
III - Advanced Farming
ftbquests.chapter.ivi__mechanical_farmin: Manually harvesting from Worm Farms gets old fast. An &6Auto Worm Farm&r cultivates worms in an automatable way, with the added bonus of not needing any inputs!
It can be used to automate Crab Traps, provided you have an automated way to turn Worms into Crab Trap Bait.
Worm Parade
&6Andesite Alloy&r is a weaker, but more flexible material used for crafting common mechanical parts.
You'll need a lot of it, so it's worth investing in cheaper ways to obtain it.
Completing the &6Boiler Room&r will give you the blueprints for mecahanical power. It will give you the power to automate parts of your farm and easily move items around.
The &6Mystical Botanist&r also has one of these for sale at a high markup.
&oCreate is not required for progression.&r
Mechanical Farming
Holding the &6w&r key while hovering over a Create item will let you see detailed information about it.
If something isn't explained in this quest chapter, chances are it's explained with Ponder!
Understood
Hold [&6W&r] to Ponder
Placing a &6Tapper&r on an &6Acacia&r tree will yield &6Sap&r the next day.
This can be smelted into &6Rubber&r, a key resource for Create used in Belts, Funnels, and other items.
Industrially Crafted Rubber
&6Water Wheels&r are the cheapest form of power crafted from simple materials.
They will move once they hit flowing water, and can be connected to Belts and machines using &6Shafts&r.
First Power
&6Mechanical Belts&r can be attached to shafts to move items around when powered. &6Funnels&r can be attached to inventories to allow belts to feed into them.
This is the primary method of moving items around in Create.
Moving Items Around
The &6Cart Assembler&r and &6Mechanical Bearing&r are disabled in this pack, with no recommended way to re-enable them.
They break the economic balance of this modpack as they can construct machines that break up 16.3k blocks a second.
Additionally, they can also bypass chunk protection mods and allow you to grief/rob other player's bases.
Understood
Where is the Mechanical Bearing \& Cart Assembler?
To progress further, you'll need to press ingots into sheets using a &6Mechanical Press&r.
Ex-Press-O
Need a bunch of stone blocks for you farm? Look no futher than the &6Mechanical Extruder&r!
It combines liquids on either side into blocks without consuming either one.
Easy Building Blocks
A &6Blaze Burner&r can be filled by right clicking a Blaze or Blaze Spawner with the empty version of it.
It can be placed below a Basin and Mixer and given fuel to craft alloys.
Metal Alloying
&6Mechanical Harvesters&r are the ultimate form of crop collecting, allowing you to automate your farm completely.
Once crafted, they can be duplicated using a cheaper recipe.
The most important alloy for progression is &6Brass&r. It is a combination of Copper and Zinc, with a Gold Coin used as a catalyst.
&6Windmills&r are slower, and less space efficient than Water Wheels. Their main advantage is looking pretty and requiring less Lead per unit of stress.
The more &6Windmill Sails&r connected to a &6Windmill Bearing&r, the higher the stress output.
Wind Power
&6Mechanical Crafters&r are automatable Crafting Tables that have a few exclusive recipes.
&oLocometal Boilers take up a large amount of pages in JEI. The second task shows all of the availible ones.&r
Mechanical Crafter Crafts
&6Powdered Obsidian&r is a byproduct of crushing Obsidian using a pair of &6Crushing Wheels&r. It is the final resource needed for advanced farming machinery.
&oIt can also be used to cut lead, turning Lead Ingots into more Molten Lead than they're originally worth.&r
Sturdy Dust
&6Lead Sheets&r can be processed into &6Sturdy Sheets&r, a stronger material used to make Train related materials.
While Trains aren't strictly required for progression, they can be useful for long range transportation or logistical automation.
Intro to Trains
&6Void Steel&r is an optional alloy of Iridium and Eye of Ender. It's used to craft machines fueled by ender power for teleportation.
Steel of Ender
Gold and Silver alloys into &6Electrum&r. This is primarily an ingredient for upgrading tools and armor.
The tools do more damage the faster you are, while the armor pieces passively make you faster.
&6Void Motors&r have the same stress capacity and rotation speed as all other Void Motors in their network.
The network can be configured by setting the frequency using any item.
&6Void Tanks&r have the same fluid availible in its tank to all other Void Tanks in their network.
The network can be configured by setting the frequency using any item.

&6Ender Drawers&r will have the same items availible as the drawer linked remotely, no matter the distance. They can be used to transport items easily, but the cost makes them less convenient than they could be.
They can be linked using a Linking Card.
&6Silver&r is another secondary material found in the &6Skull Cavern&r.
It's commonly used in sensitive electronic equipment, and is one of the rarest ores you can find in the cavern.
Cavern Metal II
&6Mechanical Saws&r fell trees in a single swoop automatically. They can be used in contraptions to automate the collection of logs.
Once crafted, they can be duplicated using a cheaper recipe.
&6Mechanical Drills&r are simple block breakers whos speed depends on the rotation speed provided. They can be used to build large drills to clear land, or for smaller utility automations.
Once crafted, they can be duplicated using a cheaper recipe.
Items used in the storage and movement of fluids can be crafted from Copper, with Oak Resin as a sealing agent.
Fluid Movement
The &6Printer&r can be used to duplicate enchanted books with liquid experience.
This can be harvested from items or players using a &6Disenchanter&r.
&6Liquid Hyper Experience&r can be used to increase the level of the enchanted book by I, even past normal limits.
Copying Enchanted Books
&6Translocators&r are handy tools for moving around items and fluids in a single blockspace.

They can be upgraded by right clicking them with various items. Most notable upgrade is the &6Precision Mechanism&r upgrade, which allows Translocators to keep an exact amount of items in stock. Useful for complex Cooking Pot recipes.
Any Translocator
Have a large train network? Are you on a large server and constantly getting lost with the amount of train stations?
The &6Create Railways Navigator&r can help guide you, automatically planning routes and transfers to your selected destination.
&6Item Pipes&r transfer items between inventories in easier ways than Mechanical Belts.
You can place them in a line from one inventory to another, then with a Create Wrench &6Shift + Right click&r the pipe that's next to the inventory you want to take items out from.
&oPipes also cannot automate Artisan Machines&r
Get your Strong Allan wrench
Pipes!
&6Item Pipes&r are handy, but relatively slow to move items around, and don't have the filtering properties of Brass.
The &6Advanced Pipe Upgrade&r can be inserted into an extracting pipe to increase the amount of items moved at once. It also unlocks complex filtering options.
You can also set the destination of items in complex pipe networks using the &6Filter Destination Tool&r.
&6Hypertubes&r are a transportation method that uses rotational power to zoop you around your base.
The &6Entrance Block&r requires rotational power, and two of them can be linked using &6Hypertube Blocks&r using the same rules as train tracks.
Tubular Transport
The &6Schematicannon&r has been removed from the pack due to several crashes and exploits.
Luckily there's a good replacement! The &6Template Manager&r can handle all the same use cases.
Understood
No Schematicannon?
Another important use for &6Silver&r is &6Electron Tubes&r. These small lights help provide signaling logic for smarter devices such as &6Brass Funnels&r.
&6Precision Mechanisms&r are technological marvels that act as the "brain" of complex machinery.
&6Gold Coins&r are the perfect size and shape for such device, placed alongside normal cogs on a Silver Sheet.
Delicate Parts
With so many materials coming from tapping trees, a basic Tapper won't cut it. The &6Auto-Tapper&r is an alternative option, allowing you to pump out the tapped fluid from the bottom of the block.
Tapped fluids need to either be bottled or used directly.
Auto-Tapping
&6Mechanical Arms&r are a method for transporting items to multiple inputs and outputs. It's handy for automating specific tasks!
You can see a list of valid targets for it on the left side of the ponder menu.
Mechanical Movement
A &6Cooking Guide&r allows machines to easily automate the Cooking Pot.
They aren't cheap, but the right farming setup can significantly boost your profits with passive income.
Automated Kitchen
&6Lead&r is a secondary material needed for heavy machinery.
It can be found in the &6Skull Cavern&r, increasing in frequency the deeper you go.
Cavern Metal I
IV.I - Mechanical Farming

ftbquests.chapter.pantry.quest5.descript: Gold quality crops only. Only &63&r tasks required for bundle completion.
ftbquests.chapter.pantry.quest5.title: Quality Bundle
ftbquests.chapter.pantry.quest6.descript: Collecting crops of every season and animal products completes the Pantry. This gives you &648 Greenhouse Glass&r, an expensive material that allows crops of any season to grow when the glass is at most 16 blocks above the crop.
ftbquests.chapter.pantry.quest6.subtitle: Reward: Greenhouse Starter
ftbquests.chapter.pantry.quest6.title: Pantry Completed!
ftbquests.chapter.pantry.title: Pantry
ftbquests.chapter.perfection.quest10.des: This will likely be your first and easiest stop to attaining perfection, but it's one you cannot skip.
Completing each room has its own rewards and merits.
ftbquests.chapter.perfection.quest16.des: &6Sharestones&r can teleport you to any of the same color. All 4 are needed to attain perfection.
&oYou don't have to read the other Sharestone quests.&r
ftbquests.chapter.perfection.quest17.des: &6Sharestones&r can teleport you to any of the same color. All 4 are needed to attain perfection.
&oYou don't have to read the other Sharestone quests.&r
ftbquests.chapter.perfection.quest18.des: &6Sharestones&r can teleport you to any of the same color. All 4 are needed to attain perfection.
&oYou don't have to read the other Sharestone quests.&r
ftbquests.chapter.perfection.quest19.des: &6Sharestones&r can teleport you to any of the same color. All 4 are needed to attain perfection.
&oYou don't have to read the other Sharestone quests.&r
ftbquests.chapter.perfection.quest20.des: Clocking in at &616 million &rcoins, the &6Golden Clock&r is one of the most excruciatingly and unnecessarily expensive items in the game.
It will randomly progress all artisan machines in its 5x5x5 area, centered around the clock.
Not that you really need the money at this point.
ftbquests.chapter.perfection.quest21.des: You've done absolutely everything there is to offer in &6Society: Sunlit Valley&r. Your farm is the envy of all your neighbors for miles.
You feel empty inside. The &dTrophy of Perfection&r gives you unlimited &dPrismatic Shards&r, but you fail to see the use of them at this point.
ftbquests.chapter.perfection.quest9.desc: You've scoured the lands, pillaged the mines, and annoyingly crafted too much food.
Doing this insane task is only part of the way towards having the perfect capitalist empire.
ftbquests.chapter.perfection.title: Perfection
ftbquests.chapter.relics.quest29.title: Relic Collection Complete!
ftbquests.chapter.relics.title: Relics

ftbquests.chapter.slimes.quest2.subtitle: Overworld Structures

ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest1.descripti: This chapter lists tools that will help you in building beautiful monuments to capitalism, or quaint farms.
As you can imagine, this is all very optional.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest1.title: Building Tools
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest10.descript: &6Frames&r are placeholder blocks for builds that can be quickly replaced by right clicking with a block.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest10.title: Framing out a Building
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest11.descript: The &6Workbench&r is used for crafting advanced furniture, and blocks from furniture catalogs!
It can be purchased from the &6Blacksmith&r but requires power to operate.
You can burn solid fuel in a generator and connect it to the &6Workbench&r using the &6Electric Wrench&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest11.title: Furniture Crafting
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest12.descript: To craft special furniture using the &6Workbench&r, you may need items purchased from a catalog.
These can be bought from a &6Mystical Botanist&r, and placed in world.
Right click them with &6Coins&r to purchase the crafting items for that furniture set.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest12.title: Furniture Catalogs
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest13.descript: The &6Saw&r cuts logs into any type of wooden item. Useful for building or annoying crafts.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest14.descript: The &6DIY Workbench&r crafts any Furniture Catalog item for a very low material cost.
It is also excruciatingly and unnecessarily expensive.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest14.subtitle: The Money Sink
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest15.descript: The &6Magnifying Glass&r shows the working area of certain blocks using right click (Use while crouching if the block has an inventory).
A list of blocks it works on is in the tooltip when holding shift.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest16.descript: Tired of hearing your Villagers? Click the "mute" icon in your inventory to open up the &6Extreme Sound Muffler&r GUI, allowing you to mute specific sounds!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest16.title: Muting Sounds
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest17.descript: The &6Template Manager&r allows you to create and upload schematics! These can be used in other worlds, making it a good way to design buildings in creative and auto-build them in survival.
A &6Copy-Paste&r gadget is needed for this to be useful.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest17.title: Schematics!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest2.descripti: &6Gadgets&r can be used to create, exchange, copy, and destroy portions of the world.
They are extremely powerful once you learn how to use them, but the UI may be confusing to newcomers. &6Gadgets for Derps&r explains how to use them in detail.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest3.descripti: &6Copycat Blocks&r mimic the texture of the block that you right click with.
This can be used to make stairs, ladders, and other variants of blocks that don't have them (e.g concrete blocks).
This also comes in variants that don't normally exist in Minecraft, such as slopes.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest3.title: Copycat Blocks
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest4.descripti: &6Construction Wands&r allow you to quickly place blocks in a line or surface. Each tier increases durability, and the amount of blocks that can be placed at a time.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest4.subtitle: Mass block placement
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest4.title: Building Wands
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest5.descripti: The &6Angel Core&r lets you to place blocks in midair using wands.
The &6Destruction Core&r allows you to void blocks the same way that you build them with a wand.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest5.title: Building Wand Cores
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest6.descripti: The &6Wand of Symmetry&r places a mirror in the world that mirrors block placement.
Shift + Right click lets you switch the pattern of placement.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest6.title: Placing Symmetrically
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest7.descripti: The &6Trowel&r places blocks in your hotbar randomly. Good for paving long paths of gravel and stone!
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest7.title: Random Placement
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest8.descripti: The &6Hammer&r can be used to crush stones into other forms, i.e Stone -> Cobblestone -> Gravel.
The &6Chisel&r turns blocks into their chiseled variants if they exist.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest8.title: Chiseling and Cracking
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest9.descripti: The &6Abacus&r measures the distance between two blocks using right click.
ftbquests.chapter.tools.quest9.title: Measuring Blocks
ftbquests.chapter.tools.title: Building Tools
Sunlit Valley offers many transportation options for the many types of players.
This page lists all the options for getting around your world.
ftbquests.chapter.transportation.quest10: Minecarts can be linked using the &6Mob Spring&r or &6Cart Coupling&r.
ftbquests.chapter.transportation.quest11: &6Create Railways Navigator&r is an addon that allows for more detailed display of routes and stations.
ftbquests.chapter.transportation.quest12: The End does not exist in Sunlit Valley.
To craft an &6Elytra&r, you'll need to purchase the expensive parts, and conquer to &6Skull Cavern&r.
Alternatively, an &6Abandoned Farm&r may be repaired to obtain one...
ftbquests.chapter.transportation.quest13: Build highways around your world lined with fields of corn, the true capitalist dream.
The &6Auto Mechanic Table&r can be used to make car parts that are then assembled on an &6Automobile Assembler&r.
ftbquests.chapter.transportation.quest14: A &6Crowbar&r can get you out of a ditch by completely breaking apart your car, but is very much a last resort opton.
The &6Car Key&r solves this issue by letting you "park" an Automobility vehicle inside of it.
ftbquests.chapter.transportation.quest15: The &6Hearthstone&r is an expensive item with limited uses sold by the &6Cleric&r that teleports you to your spawn point from anywhere.
&oYou can get some extra uses out if it by enchanting it with Unbreaking and Mending.&r
ftbquests.chapter.transportation.quest16: Like the description suggests, striking your &6Hearthstone&r with lightning will allow it to be bound to a single location. Outside of that, it has the same exact properties as before.
This can easily be done with a &6Charging Rod&r during a storm.
ftbquests.chapter.transportation.quest17: The &6Magic Mirror&r teleports you to your spawn point provided it is in range.
The range can be upgraded, and works cross-dimensionally.
It is a reward for completing the &6Crafts Room&r.
ftbquests.chapter.transportation.quest18: Teleportation is rare and expensive in this pack, encouraging you to build out your infrastructure at first.
If you cannot live without it, take a look at the "Paving The Road" quest first.
ftbquests.chapter.transportation.quest19: &6Sharestones&r are sold by the &6Mystical Botanist&r and can be used to teleport to any of the same color.
Collecting all 4 will let you craft them into a &6Waystone&r which has the same functionality, but lets you teleport to them using scrolls and Warp Stones.
Minecarts are an early-mid game form of transport for both items, players, and mobs.
They are simple but elegant, and have options to make them even faster.
&6Wooden Rails&r are cheaper, with a slower maximum speed.
&6Maglev rails&r have a much higher maximum speed than normal rails.
&6Lightspeed Rails&r have an extremely high max speed, but can't slope or turn.
Two signs can be linked as teleporters if there is a high quality path between them.
&6Shift + Left Click&r&r to start/end linking. You'll need to travel on the path to the sign you want to link to.
You can search "&6#path_block&r" in JEI to see all the valid path blocks.
Create Trains are the ultimate form of railway transport, allowing you to build large custom locomotives with multiple cars.
Tracks and Train gear can be crafted without Create Progression!
They can also be automated using &6Train Schedules&r to transport items and fluids.
&6Small Ships&r allow for traversing the sea quickly. They come in different variants that do better or worse in different ocean biomes.
They have large inventories, and can be mounted with cannons or colored with dye.
They can be angled upwards by applying a redstone signal.
There are wooden and maglev variants, with a shorter and longer max length respectively.
ftbquests.chapter.transportation.title: Transportation
ftbquests.chapter.vault.quest1.title: 2,048 Bundle
ftbquests.chapter.vault.quest2.title: 16,384 Bundle
ftbquests.chapter.vault.quest3.title: 24,576 Bundle
ftbquests.chapter.vault.quest4.title: 40,960 Bundle
ftbquests.chapter.vault.quest5.descripti: Purchasing the Vault gives you a &6Skull Cavern Teleporter&r, your gateway to obtaining &dPrismatic Shards&r.
Place it down and right click to enter, but be sure to come prepared! Mobs in the Skull Cavern have twice as much health and damage...
&oThe &6Skull Cavern Teleporter&r&o can also be bought from the &6Blacksmith&r&o for a high price if it is lost somehow.
ftbquests.chapter.vault.quest5.subtitle: Reward: Skull Cavern Teleporter
ftbquests.chapter.vault.quest5.title: Vault Completed!
ftbquests.chapter.vault.title: Vault
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest1.descr: There are 14 types of villagers to buy various goods from!
You can see a list of &6Workstations&r on this page, or by searching "Workstation" in JEI.
The items locked behind a certain Villager can also be searched for by searching "Sold by" and then the villager type in JEI.
Villagers do not unlock more items on level up.
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest1.title: Buying Goods
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest10.desc: The &6Cleric&r sells wands, experience, and advanced potion and brewing equipment.
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest11.desc: The &6Master Cultivator&r sells advanced seeds that are worth more than the more easily accessible ones.
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest12.desc: The &6Barkeeper&r sells basic foods for convenience.
You can also buy &6Lunchboxes&r, which hold a variety of foods, and you can eat directly from it.
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest13.desc: Deep in the &6Skull Caverns&r you can find Prismatic Shards from Omni Geodes and Trial Chambers.
They can be used to craft advanced Villager workstations...
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest14.desc: The &6Exotic Trader&r barters select items for more difficult to obtain ones.
They have limited stock compared to other villagers!
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest15.desc: The &6Mystical Botanist&r sells furniture catalogs used in crafting special furniture, as well as mystical teleportation stones.
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest16.desc: The &6Leatherworker&r sells various leather goods and sewing items. Most importantly; &6Sleeping Bags&r, which allow you to sleep without setting your spawn.
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest2.descr: The &6Blacksmith&r is one of the most important villagers, selling ingots and geode processing tools.
They also sell access to the &6Nether&r in the form of a Flint and Steel.
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest2.title: Blacksmith
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest3.descr: The &6Bard&r sells fun tools for music, photography, and custom paintings.
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest3.title: Bard
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest4.descr: The &6Banker&r sells tools related to buying and selling with other plays.
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest4.title: Banker
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest5.descr: The &6Farmer&r is one of the most important villagers, selling fertilizers and farming tools.
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest5.title: Farmer
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest6.descr: The &6Librarian&r sells paper goods, enchanting tools, and &6Mending&r books.
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest6.title: Librarian
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest7.descr: The &6Fisher&r sells &6Fishing Rods&r, and upgrades for them.
Fish are a fast and valuable way to make money early game.
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest7.title: Fisher
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest8.descr: The &6Shepherd&r sells husbandry equipment like &6Animal Feed&r and &6Milk Pails&r. You can even purchase a small selection of farm animals to get started.
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest8.title: Shepherd
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest9.descr: The &6Storagesmith&r sells expensive upgrades for storage drawers and chests.
It also has the parts for &6Refined Storage&r, a powerful storage system.
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.quest9.title: Storagesmith
ftbquests.chapter.villagers.title: Villagers
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest1.descrip: Where farming meets lightly industrialized capitalism.
Expand your farming empire and become wealthy in the process.
This questbook will give you an introduction to the concepts of the pack, and serve as a journal for collectable items.
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest1.subtitl: You only have to read this one
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest1.title: Welcome!
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest2.descrip: Many recipes in this pack are modified or require currency.
Like games such as Stardew Valley and Harvest Moon, exploit the earth for profit!
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest2.title: Shipping and Currency
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest3.descrip: Teleportation does exist, however you will have to invest massive amounts of cash to buy it.
Alternatively, you can build out a network of roads and teleport between them using signs.
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest3.title: Transportation
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest4.descrip: Spice of Life: Onion Edition has been added to incentivize eating different foods.
Reaching certain thresholds of food diversity will give you benefits listed in the book. Most notably: extra health!
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest4.title: The Spice of Life
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest5.descrip: Press &6o&r to enable, provided your PC has the specs capable for them.
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest5.title: Shaders?
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest6.descrip: If you're running a server with more than a handful of people that will be on at seperate times, you should change the season length in the configs.
This can be done by changing the &6sub_season_duration&r in &6config/sereneseasons/seasons.toml&r.
Having this value set to 16-20 is recommended on larger severs to prevent someone from grinding out an entire season in one day.
&oNote: Players will also need to update their configs for the season UI to match the servers.&r
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest6.title: For Server Owners
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest7.descrip: This pack has a configuration! Things like the Stardew Fishing minigame or hospital fees can be turned off.
In the modpack folder, go to the folder &6kubejs&r and then &6startup_scripts&r.
Find the file &6_config.js&r, and open it up with Notepad. Update the values save the file, and restart the game.
If you're on a server, the server admin may need to change these values as well.
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest7.subtitl: Want to change something? Do it!
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest7.title: Configuring the Pack
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest8.descrip: Sunlit Valley is a more peaceful oriented modpack! This means:
- Inventory is kept on death (Though tool durability will be lost)
- Phantoms and Pillager patrols no longer spawn
This doesn't mean there's no danger however. &6The underground, Nether, and Skull Cavern are as dangerous as ever&r....
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest8.title: More Peaceful Experience
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest9.descrip: Want to protect your base or keep it loaded? Chunks can be claimed using the JourneyMap - &6j&r key by default.
